39355154.review:
This is a very mellow game that is absolutely bursting with child-like imagination. The puzzles are interesting and not too difficult, although there is sometimes an artificial challenge created by cause and effect being unclear (it's not necessarily obvious if and how certain elements can be interacted with). The pacing is very slow, and you will spend a decent amount of time watching quaint little animations play out (sometimes more than once if you missed something the first time around). I do not consider this a downside, but I also suggest playing when you're suitably relaxed.

The story is fairly straightforward and is told without words, which makes it feel rewarding as you uncover more of it. The art is superb, and very weird.

Wraz z pociesznym bohaterem przemierzamy światy rodem ze snu, czy fantastyki i spotykamy ich przedziwnych mieszkańców. Każda z odwiedzanych krain to zupełnie odmienny mikroświat pełen zaskakujących istot, tajemniczych mechanizmów i dopracowanych, w większości umiarkowanie skomplikowanych zagadek, których samodzielne rozwiązanie sprawia jednak dużo satysfakcji. Podziwiam autorów za ogromne pokłady fantazji, których możemy doświadczać przez tę grę oraz to, jak dopracowane jest to dzieło. To po prostu piękne, oniryczne doświadczenie.

価格の分だけボリュームやグラフィックは非常にグレードアップしていますが、私は詰まったら攻略みつつ4時間ほどでクリアした作品なので…はい。

39195468.review:
[h1]Samorost 3[/h1]

[i]集大成者！扛鼎之作！[/i]

捷克的独立游戏工作室Amanita Design曾开发过一款好评如潮的植物风格解密游戏[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/canyonlq/recommended/207690]Botanicula[/url]和一款屡获殊荣的机械风格解密游戏[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/canyonlq/recommended/40700]Machinarium[/url]。时隔七年他们推出了Samorost 3。这部游戏吸取了前作优秀的元素并融合到了一起，最终铸成了一部堪称 [i]完美[/i] 的作品。

+画风的融合 [b]无机与有机共同描绘的奇幻世界[/b]
如果说Botanicula是明亮的萌系画风，Machinarium是废土式的漫画画风，那么Samorost 3就是两者的融合。
漂浮在苍茫宇宙中的一截枯木，浮游与于浩瀚星空中的鱼类星球，围绕着恒星的孢子飞船，在这个打破常规的世界里，有机物和无机物的界限变得模糊，植物和机械相互依存，长着螺栓的披着植物的远古星球，善用机械的土著生物，内含钥匙机簧的果实卫星，这些生物的存在是那么的不可思议，却又意外和谐。画师用细腻的笔触描绘了每一个场景的细节，每一幅画面不是绝对的静止：有闪烁的星辰，有爬行的小虫，有摇曳的枝叶；设计师为每一幅画面添了富含众多元素的背景，苍茫，幽邃，磅礴，神秘，每当小小的主人翁步入下一个环境时，总会惊喜于新的发现，总会被场景震撼。
游戏整体的色调并不统一，不像两部前作在一个方向走向极致：有的星球寂寥荒，长满凸起的怪岩；有的星球生机盎然，奇特的动物隐匿于山林间，这种色调的单一与复杂互相交错，让玩家没有审美疲劳。
游戏中解密元素和环境完美的融合在了一起，设计师将道具隐藏于场景中，画师又将这些元素完美地融合到环境里，没有一丁点的突兀，显得合乎常理又十分巧妙。

+元素的融合 [b]难度适中 数量合适[/b]
     Botanicula的美中不足在于游戏解谜难度不够，收集元素又多的惊人(123个)
     Machinarium的美中不足在于解谜难度非常高，没有隐藏/收集元素。[spoiler]是的就是没有= =玩的时候真的很惊讶[/spoiler]
     Samorost 3的解密难度适中，和Machinarium一样提供了攻略书，而且不用再玩时间相对较长的小游戏来解锁，只需要转一转转盘，这一点可谓诚意十足了。游戏一共提供了30个收集元素，沿用了类似Botanicula的收集系统，以小唱片的形式记录在游戏下方，当鼠标滑过时收集的声音就会播放出来，在游戏后期收集多了鼠标随便一划就是一场精彩纷呈的演唱会，简直绝赞！

[b]+10/10的原声音乐[/b]
     如果你想入手Samorost 3请将原声DLC一起购入。
     好听到让你忘了这是个解谜游戏！好听到不去下一个场景等这一段bgm放完！Samorost 3的音乐就是这么好听。[spoiler]严格来说这就是一个音乐游戏呀~你看开局一人一狗装备全靠捡，天上掉下个金喇叭，主角试了一下就会吹了耶~于是就用喇叭收集自然界的各种声音，其实就是万物灵魂的低语，然后自己吹一遍就能和他们交流了诶~然后真正的故事才刚刚开始=W=[/spoiler]Samorost 3依旧没有语言文字，一首bgm带出银河的苍茫浩瀚，一首bgm带你领略自然绚丽风光，一首bgm带你走进万物的内心世界。[spoiler]不是我吹，是主角吹，他的确有这个能力~[/spoiler]

写在最后：评分10/10
完美！作为一款解谜游戏，Samorost 3就是完美的。从画面到剧情到音乐到附加的收集元素和彩蛋，完全可称之为解谜游戏的扛鼎之作。
82¥的售价物有所值，建议在打折季购入或是其他渠道喜加一。

[i]感谢Amanita Design制作的这份精美而全面的艺术品，同时也期待今年新游戏的发布[/i]

38840074.review:
Simplemente... maravilloso

Samorost 3 definitivamente es la version más pulida y detallada de la saga samorost, y en general, para mi, el juego más complejo que han creado los chicos de Amanita Design.

Un nivel de detalle exorbitante, unos efectos de sonido abdsorbentes, y una banda sonora muy concecuente al ambiente hacen que samorost 3 sea una experiencia maravillosa.

En esta ocación nuestro gnomo espacial favorito encuentra una extraña "flauta" en mitad de su jardín. Al interactuar con ella se da cuenta que es una flauta mágica que proviene de algún lugar lejano en el cielo; por tanto nuestro objetivo será encontrar a su dueño.

Al igual que en las entregas anteriores la trama es sencilla, pero en esta ocación los escenarios que surcaremos, las criaturas que veremos, los personajes que conoceremos, y puzzles que resolveremos están mejores que nunca; además, la banda sonora y los diversos sonidos ambientales (y de criaturas), que se escuchan al ir avanzando por cada zona, hacen que el juego sea una experiencia absorvente y visualmente espectacular.

Por si todo lo anterior no fuera poco, ésta vez incluyeron una especie de "mundo abierto", en donde se puede llegar al final del juego sin necesidad de pasar todos los puzzles; además de agregar una serie de "sonidos ocultos" (que a su vez representan los logros del juego) los cuales se podrán encontrar realizando ciertas acciones en momentos dados; por tanto, si deseas pasar el juego al 100% deberás prestar muchísima atención a los detalles y dejarte llevar por la ambientación y tu intuición.

Nada más que decir, un juego indie 100% recomendado para todos aquellos amantes de las novelas gráficas, los point & click, los juegos de puzzles, y en general para cualquier jugador casual amante del bello arte y la buena música.

Nota: 9/10

38822073.review:
A piece of art disguised as a game! 

If you like games with beautiful artwork, this is definitely a game for you. I absolutely love the psychedelic, colourful, organic artwork of Amanita games and the soothing, sometimes catchy, music completes it. Play in dim light for full trippy effect!
And even if you don't care too much about art, but you do like some brainteasing: this is also for you. The puzzles are not impossible, but can be quite challenging because sometimes the things you need to do seem to not really make sense. Or do they? I think that's charming about this game: it's intended to be a bit weird. 
You get guided through the classic 'good vs. evil' story by the characters you meet and the puzzles you need to solve. On your way you can earn tokens (achievements), which makes you want to click everything again and again. Perfect game for a moment of relaxation. Overall it's really peaceful, the music is stunning, and the artwork so beautiful that I made dozens of screenshots to use as wallpaper ;-)


Only three tiny remarks, not necessarily cons:

1. I found the menu a bit hard because it's only icons and no explanation (however this fits the aesthetics of the game, plus it makes the game accessible for children who can't read or don't understand English).

2. The game is animated to the tiniest detail and animations cannot be skipped...which means you will have to wait quite a lot for animations to finish and a wrong click can cost you minutes in some cases, staring at the same animation again. This is not a game for those who just want to rush to the finish! And that's actually good, because this is a game you really need to experience and not just play through for achievements.

3. I finished the game in little under 6 hours (no rush) and it has no real replay value. Now normally I would find this a reason to not pay €20 for a game. However, I understand that this game must have cost an incredible amount of time and effort to make, so I'm not saying that it's not worth it. If you can afford it, I would pay full price to support the developers. But if you're not that wealthy, I would wait a bit and pick it up on sale.


10/10 - would secretly smoke the shisha again

38669734.review:
This is a neat little point and click adventure game with stunning graphics and fascinating soundtracks. We follow the life of a little protagonist who finds a mysterious flute which enables him to talk with spirits and help them out. The main focused aspects of the game is creativity and you are whisked towards a world of magic and fantasies. 

Not a single comprehensible word is uttered throughout the game yet you are touched by the music and picture animation stories. You have the opprotunity to explore and solve various puzzles and interact with exotic creatures from many planets by a space ship. It's fascinating to see how music could be derived from pure nature itself, if you manage to gain all achievements like I did then a surprise will await you at the achievements menu. 

My final impression would be sheer fascination by the story, artwork and the different types of music I heard and experienced. Great game when you are bored or want to relax your brain.

38619119.review:
[quote=][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/12146432-La-Cruceta-Inquieta/][b]La Cruceta Inquieta[/b][/url], mentor de Steam[/quote]

Tras dos entregas interesantes pero que quedaban casi como un mero experimento de escasas horas de duración, la tercera entrega de Samorost aparece habiendo aprendido de errores pasados para, a su vez, fortalecer sus muchas virtudes. Y es que es innegable que se trata de un juego bonito, pero es que además es capaz de transportarnos a un mundo fantástico, preciosista y tranquilo que se agradece entre tanta y tanta propuesta de acción vertiginosa sin fin. 

Una vez más, deberemos guiar a nuestro duendecillo interestelar de las dos entregas anteriores a través de un viaje interplanetario, resolviendo los problemas de sus moradores al mismo tiempo que servimos a una causa mayor para restablecer el orden cósmico y que finalmente nos llevará a poder seguir disfrutando de la inmensa tranquilidad de nuestro planeta/satélite/asteroide. Todo esto nos lo narra Samorost 3 a través de un argumento que, a pesar de no tener pretensiones grandilocuentes, se sigue con interés, ayudado por el estilo de juego propio de los "point and click". Por tanto, no se nos ofrecen aquí grandes hazañas ni actuaciones heroicas, simplemente se nos plantea un viaje tranquilo y pausado, pretexto perfecto para disfrutar de su maravillosa dirección artística y de las impresiones que ésta nos provoca.

Personalmente creo que no exagero afirmando que, gráficamente, Samorost 3 es uno de los videojuegos más bonitos que he jugado. Todo ha sido dibujado a mano con un inmenso cuidado por el detalle y por ofrecer panorámicas de una singular belleza escasamente habitual en el medio. Mientras transcurre la aventura no será extraño el quedarse parado admirando todo tipo de detalles y rincones. Además, todo este cuidado no se limita únicamente a los fondos, sino que la genial dirección artística también alcanza otros aspectos como el diseño de personajes y sus animaciones. Todo en su conjunto, como ya se comentaba al principio, nos traslada a un mundo especial, elaborado con enorme cuidado para ser disfrutado con toda la tranquilidad del mundo.

En cuanto a su apartado sonoro, obviamente no podía quedarse atrás y acompaña a la perfección al resto de aspectos. Así, en nuestro viaje disfrutaremos de una banda sonora y unos efectos sonoros compuestos con enorme delicadeza y que no harán sino aumentar nuestra inmersión en el mundo onírico y fantasioso de Samorost 3. Cabe mencionar como destacado el sonido de las flautas de las que haremos uso y que, en su contexto, nos dejaran embobados frente a la pantalla.

Finalmente, y a diferencia del resto de apartados, poco se puede destacar de la jugabilidad de Samorost 3 ya que apenas se aleja de las directrices clásicas del género de los "point and click" o aventuras gráficas. No obstante, nos ofrece algunos puzles bastante ingeniosos, aunque de una dificultad bastante asequible, que, en su mayoría y al igual que sucede con sus originales logros, integran de una forma genial tanto aspectos gráficos como sonoros y jugables. Lo cierto es que animan mucho a seguir profundizando en el videojuego y ver a dónde nos llevarán en nuestro siguiente paso. 

Concluyendo, Samorost 3 no deja de ser una aventura gráfica que se permite pocas variaciones respecto a la clásica fórmula del género, pero, si disfrutas con éstas, encontrarás un videojuego preciosista en casi todos sus apartados y que hace de la sencillez y la tranquilidad sus principales bazas, algo, creo, nada desdeñable en la actualidad.

38570931.review:
Oczywiście kolejne arcydzieło, bo to w końcu gra od studia Amanita Design. Po zagraniu w Machinarium po prostu musiałem kupić Amanita Bundle (czyli zestaw wszystkich gier tego studia). Jak Samorost i Samorost 2 były całkiem spoko point-and-click'ami, tak Samorost 3 przebił pod względem dopracowania nawet Machinarium (no, w końcu Machinarium to gra z 2009 roku, a Samorost jest z 2016). Grafika oczywiście piękna, soundtrack oczywiście idealny, klimat i fabuła oczywiście wciągające, no czego tu chcieć więcej od Amanita Design. Czasem były takie momenty, przez które po prostu szczęka opadała, czego w Machinarium nie miałem.

Mnie przejście gry zajęło 5 godzin, ale spokojnie dałoby się ją zrobić w jakieś 4,5, może nawet trochę mniej. Ogólnie Samorost 3 jest łątwiejszy niż np. Machinarium. Gra kosztuje 60 zł nie ze względu na jej długość, tylko na jej dopracowanie i klimat. Spodziewałem się, że będzie trochę dłuższa, coś jak Machinarium (9 godzin), ale spokojnie wystarczy. Po skończeniu gry zrobiłem 60% osiągnięć, więc jeszcze trochę gry mi zostało :) No i polecam kupić jeszcze DLC zawierające soundtrack i PDf'a z concept art'ami (albo jak wspomniałem wczesniej, kupić cały zestaw Amanita Bundle).

Bardzo polecam, piękna gra.

This game is an experience.
This game is not a puzzle.
This game is a different world for you to explore and feel and try to understand.
There is really not much else like it out there.

It's a fairly short game, puzzles are manageable without hints, although you may have to beat your head against the wall (or the tree or the rock crabs) for some time before you figure them out.
Also, this is not always the most logical of all games. So if you're an engineer who needs everything to make sense you may want to pass this one by, as you'll just get focused on all the wrong things and will end up hating and not understanding it.

Even when clocking in for a hint, you still have to use some bits of reasoning to tell what the pages are saying, still giving you the feeling that you solved the puzzle. It's really nice not having to leave the game to solve a tougher bit. However, you won't even need the hints for most of the game, as many of the scenarios are very intuitive, and just work well. Very worth it!

38464826.review:
https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/863992929213876245/FD938341F747B2434544A7B486B5FFF53AA62096/
對於我個人，上面這張圖大概才是整個遊戲的精華（？？？

jelly band，手機上僅存的常駐遊戲，時不時就會拿出來聽兩下。這種東西的功用其實很神秘，說是能激發靈感但實際遊戲只重複的循環一首曲子。Samorost 3的這東西也是差不多意思（不好意思沒玩過這個系列，不知道前作是不是也有，找時間補），重點就是它音效多，而且取材於很多角度比較特別的聲音（雖然全部轉起來的話...效果確實沒有jelly band那種特別調整過的比較和諧）。

雖然它本意好像是在講一個很高級的東西。但是至從我在某個點卡關後在遊戲裡到處亂點點出了官方攻略後，這遊戲對我的動力就只在好奇它還能挖出什麼聲音。遊戲的謎題在很多地方其實沒什麼邏輯性，如果沒有攻略，就僅僅是排列組合汗試錯。這讓遊戲的推動變成一個看風景，翻攻略，解題的聽起來就很無聊的過程。尤其是像我這種為了要挖出每個地方的音樂就要每個場景都翻攻略時，qnmdgl。

其實這遊戲對我來說蠻出戲的，從第一眼看到它拿著個喇叭到處聽，我就第一時間想到了拿著麥克風帶著個耳機在大街上到處亂晃的景象。我個人是一直覺得聽覺是比視覺更高級別的感官，因為你能通過聲音去想像出圖像來（這種圖像的形成，主要還是要靠曾經的視覺記憶，他們其實還是屬於互補的）。我不能變成螞蟻的是視角去看這個世界，但是我能通過捕捉微小的聲音放大後去想像變成它們角度的這個世界。你能看到和聽到海浪，但你未必能注意到馬桶中形成的海浪。

視覺++

聽覺++++

解謎--

攻略書-∞

38459643.review:
This game is just lovely. The setting is mysterious enough that it can be a bit spooky, but as you complete the puzzles, each planet becomes a bit warmer and more welcoming.

The puzzles are a bit atmospheric, in that it's not always a directly logical solve, but they are the right level of difficulty to not be frustrating, while still providing a nice sense of accomplishment and relief once complete.

I love all the silly little characters around the worlds, and I am particularly fond of how each scene reveals its secrets over the course of solving a puzzle. Sometimes the lighting will change and reveal a hidden world right in front of you, or you will gradually realize that all the different parts of the scene relate in a particular way.

The music is 100% the best part of this OTHERWISE AMAZING point and click puzzler. I have completed three planets thus far (I'm really enjoying completing just one planet per play session), and I've literally gotten out of my chair to dance by myself to the music twice. The best part of that is the fact that in both cases where the soundtrack just got too good to resist, it wasn't just playing because I arrived at a certain location, but my actions in solving puzzles helped to construct the soundtrack that turned into an amazing song once the puzzle was done. I literally keep going back to these sections just to re-do the puzzles and jam out to the music it's amazing!

38132073.review:
Саморост - это увлекательное путешествие по фантасмагорическим пейзажам макромира, населенного знакомыми и порой странными существами. Все время не покидало ощущение, что весь сюжет происходит не в космосе, а скорее в трехлитровой банке с вечным террариумом) И ведь игра игрой, а идея в ней сильная - гармония с природой. И к любому существу, будь то камень или дерево, можно найти "ключик" для общения.
Музыкальная и звуковая атмосфера на 5+++!  Настолько живые и сочные звуки... И очень интерактивный мир: настолько приятно касаться цветочка, гонять кроликов и птичек) А лай таксы и вовсе заворожил с первой минуты еще в прошлых версиях игры. 
Жаль, что автор не решился обновить первые две части и выпустить их вместе с 3-ей сразу в одной игре. Было бы здорово. Но и без того, Саморост 3 - очаровательная и по-настоящему "вкусная" игра. А главное - добрая, в самом что ни на есть прямом смысле этого слова.

38114419.review:
Existem jogos que te deixa irritado, existem jogos que te deixa com medo, existem jogos que te deixa decepcionado, e existem jogos como este que te deixa boquiaberto por uns 5 minutos só se deleitando com o ambiente, sem você ter de tocar em nada, apenas admirando o belo trabalho de arte.
Depois de resgatar seu cachorro (Samorost 2), o personagem volta pro seu planeta, pra viver sua vida. Mas um objeto curioso cai do céu (Samorost 3) e ele acaba vendo as coisas ao seu redor com outra perspectiva, pois algo ruim no seu universo (que não é apenas o caos da termodinâmica) está acontecendo e ele irá atrás pra fazer sua parte.
Com instruções biológicas, químicas e zoológicas, Samorost 3 apresenta-se em forma de arte minusciosamente trabalhada, música que você mesmo pode compor e ciência nua e crua.
Fiquei apaixonado em como o jogo te ensina coisas e te instrui o que fazer em cada área.
SENSACIONAL! 10/10

37994357.review:
I would consider myself a veteran in adventure/puzzle games, having played most of the Sierra Quest games, all the LucasArts classics, and most recently Deponia. I also thought Machinarium was a nice little title, if a bit too heavy on the independent puzzle section.

All that said I don't recommend Samorost to anyone - veteran or new players alike. 

Samorost tries to differentiate itself from adventure games by being completely dialogue free. The story is told through pictures and small animations made of smoke/clouds. It avoids the huge inventory issue in other titles, and most puzzles are solved through interacting with the environment in a precise way. Move this tube there while turning this switch on, etc.

Samorost fails in telling us what exactly we can interact it. The mouse cursor will change when hovering over objects/environment if you can interact with it, but usually only if you're close enough. Even then it won't make much sense. How exactly can I move this giant pole back and forth? Wait, you're telling me I can reach the top of a 15 ft plant? The annoyance of having to mouse-over everything is hampered further by extremely onerous travel. While samorost can 'run', some sections have far too lengthy travel between different scenes, making going between areas extremely tedious. Second, 'talking' to people brings up an uninterruptible cloud animation every time. And these aren't short! They are pushing 30 seconds + for some of them. There's also tons of things you can randomly interact with that do absolutely nothing. You can think of them as Easter Eggs but more numerous.

As this is a game you have to 'explore' on your own, I accidently looked at the hint book, not knowing I was actually 'cheating'. Thankfully the hints are mostly useless for the problems I was having. I was able to complete it without a walkthrough, but that satisfying "Ah ha!" moment you have when figuring out a particularly devious puzzle is absent here.

The same issue that bothered me about Machinarium, namely isolated puzzle segments (think solving a Rubick's Cude in the game) crop up more often than I'd like.

Aesthetically it's fine. I wasn't as smitten as some are with the art style and frankly as time wore on and the game annoyed me more and more it started feeling repetetive and even ugly. 

Stay far away from this, even on sale. It's a combination of frustration and tedium in one inexpensive package.

37981048.review:
Amanita Design'ın çıkardığı ilk oyunlardan biri olan Samorost 1'den sonra 2016 yılında gelişen tecrübelerle beraber flash oyun olmaktan çıkıp daha iyi bir oyun moturuyla Samorost 3'ü geliştirmişler. Oyunun teması ve tarzı diğer oyunlarla aynı. İlk iki oyun oldukça kısa oyunlarken bu oyunun ortalama süresi 4 saat. Tüm bir seriyi birgünde oturup bitirebiliceğimiz çıtır çerez oyunlardan. Oyunun görsel sanatıyla birlikte aynı derecede müzikleri şahane tasarlanmış. Oynayana huzur veren bu müzikler oyunu sıkıcı bir atmosferden çıkarmayı başarmış. 

Puzzle kısımları gayet kolay. Bazı bölümleri geçmek için oyundaki kitaptan yardım alabiliyoruz. Kitabı açmak için ise minik bir puzzle konulmuş. Bu puzzle her bölümde daha da zorlaşması gerekirdi. Her bölümde açmak oldukça kolay ve aynı sistem. Bu özelliği oyunu bir hayli kolaylaştırmış. Bunun yanı sıra oyunda bulduğumuz kitaplarda hikaye örgüsü çizgiroman gibi gayet anlaşılır bir şekilde açıklanmış. Genel anlamda türüne göre iyi bir oyun. Özellikle görsel sanat ve müzikleri. Botanicula ve Machinarium oyunlarını oynadıysanız ve sevdiyseniz bu oyunuda tavsiye ederim. 

Oyun Puanı: 7/10

37958803.review:
作品本身的质量无可挑剔，
从艺术性的角度来讲， 无论是画面还是音乐都不可谓不惊艳
但从游戏性的角度来讲， 这部作品较其他解密类的作品可能稍逊一筹

想要享受这款游戏，你需要看看自己具备以下几点：
1. 能否能忍受几乎无指引的游戏流程
游戏中完全没有文字的出现，所有谜题包括线索都是用图画表现，甚至要靠自己的鼠标点点点去寻找
配合上游戏超丰富的背景和细节，这个过程有时候会让人莫名地烦躁
起码在我的游玩过程中，相当一部分时间都是在寻找或理解谜面是什么而不是去解决谜题
打算购买此游戏的玩家要提前打好预防针（[spoiler] 或是直接去看攻略[/spoiler]

2. 是否有耐心等待主人公跑图
我一直觉得我自己算是一个有耐心的人，然而这种耐心也要分时候
主人公跑一面快则几秒钟，慢则几十秒还要跟场景互动
当你终于找到了解决谜题的线索还要跑几分钟路才能去解题的时候，解密的快感会随时间稀释的很厉害
解密类游戏需要进入状态，而这款游戏
会让你看风景

3. 较弱且模糊的主线
跟解密类游戏说剧情貌似是有些苛求，但这其实跟游戏时的心态有关
机械迷城是一个英雄救美的故事，为了救出我的真爱，我会迫不及待地去解密去推进
这种故事的安排会潜在地激发我解密的欲望，从而淡化游戏中的其他弱点
但Samorost 是一个漫游的故事，直到中后部分才将主线明确出来
配合前两点，这个缺点又被放大了
有时候你没有线索需要根据仅有的指引满地图去寻找，寻找的过程中还要忍受主人公的移动速度
而解密又只是为了下一步漫无目的的探索
这真的会让人丧失玩下去的动力，起码这三点是我为什么买了很久通关这款游戏的原因。

基于整体来看，我要推荐这款游戏，因为其本身的质量很优秀
但从通关后的感受来说，我可能并不会推荐其他人玩，因为游戏本身带给我的体验真的低于预期
希望能对后来的人们有所帮助吧

37829573.review:
И ещё одна адвентюра от Аманиты. Ребята сильно продвинулись со времён Samorost 2, хоть до Ботаникулы и Машинариума эта игра так и не доросла. Странно, что за неё хотят таких денег.

В целом же, все характерные элементы на месте - детально прорисованный мир, квесты, не требующие языка и минималистичный инвентарь. Из нового могу отметить дикую тучу необязательных головоломок - от "перекликай все листики на дереве" до "воспроизведи комбинацию нот". Они не нужны для сюжета, но дают ачивки и чувство глубокого удовлетворения.

Кроме того, каждую локацию сопровождает решебник, являющийся по совместительству сборником концепт-артов. В нём указано, как именно решать каждую локацию, а заодно даётся решение (или хотя бы намёк) на большинство необязательных головоломок.

И ещё одно неожиданное решение - здесь есть Post-Game. То есть, титры показали, а теперь можешь свободно бегать по всем планетам и собирать недобранные ачивки.

В целом - рекомендую. Но не за полную цену.

37670007.review: Если Вы хотите,чтобы Вас затянуло в мир потрясающих звуков и странных персонажей, то эта игра для Вас. Море забавных,хлюпающих,свистящих,булькающих звуков не раз заставит Вас улыбнуться. Плюс ко всему безумно порадует глаз живописная картинка и поразительно нестандартные создания (у авторов явно с фантазией все хорошо). Управление не навязчивое, простое. Помимо всех этих положительных моментов игра вовсе непростая. Ваше логическое мышление постоянно будет пребывать в неком замешательстве, так как над многими моментами придется гадать по несколько минут. Но, в целом, игра затягивает. Если сравнивать с предыдущей версией, которую можно пройти буквально за полчаса, то здесь все гораздо интереснее, продуманнее и даже есть некий сюжет. То есть ты не просто бездумно летаешь с одной чудо-планеты на другую, где на каждой из таких планет миссия и заканчивается, то здесь, необходимо будеть возвращаться, чтобы что-то доделать, доразгадать. Так что если Вы хотите, чтобы Ваша нестандарная логика аплодировала стоя, попробуйте поиграть в эту игру.

36269543.review:
[h1]我穿越一个又一个星球，只是想讲一段故事[/h1]

还记得于2009年独立游戏节上斩获视觉艺术奖的《Machinarium》（机械迷城）吗？凭借独特的手绘画风得到了一众好评，对于开发工作室的Amanita Design来说，这不是第一次获奖。早在2007年，其作品《Samorost 2》曾获得2007年最佳 Web 浏览器游戏奖，这份殊荣对于这所位于捷克中部城市布尔诺的小工作室来说意义不凡。一部部高质量的独立游戏的诞生也让Amanita Design收获了来自全世界解谜玩家的喜爱。

[h1]共通的内质[/h1]
如果你玩过Amanita Design旗下三款游戏《Samorost》、《Machinarium》和《Botanicula》，就会发现这些游戏所存在内质上的一些共同点。
—游戏内主角个性鲜明
就诸如《Machinarium》里的小机器人，通过动画和音效来表达人物特征，就比如解锁了一个难关后，机器人会手舞足蹈喜悦的上蹿下跳。在整个游戏过程中没有语言，Amanita Design的创始人曾说“阅读冗长的对话是乏味的，何况我不是个优秀的作家。当游戏从未展现已存在的语言时，它也更好地本土化了。”通过音效和简单的动作可以更加直观的表现事物，也避免了故事讲述带来的枯燥。
—互动解谜
而作为一部互动解谜游戏，Amanita Design的游戏很好的将互动性与叙事性结合，这一点在场景元素的互动可见，整个场景也是游戏的一部分，会对玩家的操作做出反馈，比如模型材质会发生变形，出现一些标志性的符号等等。如果玩家的输入与反馈不平衡，很容易让玩家产生厌烦情绪。
如果将游戏分为表和里的层次，游戏的里层次是游戏机制即游戏性如何，而那些游戏的音乐、画面、剧情等等则是表层面，这些因素会很直观的影响玩家的感官体验。就某方面来说，Amanita Design并没有就游戏的里层次做到创新，而在游戏总体美感和游戏文化塑造方面做到了极致。

[h1]沉寂后的作品[/h1]
2012年，《Botanicula》获得独立游戏节最佳音效奖，为Amanita Design再添荣誉。不过在接下来长达三年的时间里，这家捷克的工作室长于沉默，一直处于无声的状态，这类风格的游戏作品也淡出了玩家们的视野。直到2016年3月，新作《Samorost 3》的发行使得玩家重新回忆起这家曾带来乐趣的工作室。
作为一个重启ip的新作，《Samorost 3》继承了前作《Samorost 2》的特征，主打Amanita Design一贯的美学风格。21世纪初期发布的《Samorost》还只是一个flash小游戏，《Samorost 3》已经做到采用3D横版屏幕进行呈现，提高了整体场景的层次感与立体感，也符合时下玩家的体验。当然游戏场景的互动性还是依旧出色，点击树上的花花瓣会掉落，点击石头会抖落等等，同时在这些互动元素的基础上增加了收集的功能，成功触发这些元素的机制就可以收集。
游戏整体的画面与之前的作品相似，可以说是奇幻与怪异的集合体，谈不上精致与惊艳，不过在这个快节奏的游戏行业中，能够这样用心的塑造自己风格实属不易。玩家会随着故事的开展探索不同的星球，每次登陆星球会展开远景的特写从而呈现整个星球的样貌。星球上精致的场景和巧妙的解谜机关充满了想象力，整个画面风格在各元素协调下而没有失格。

[h1]三年磨一剑[/h1]
由于整部《Samorost 3》没有语言，因此故事的讲叙依靠着音效，画面和解谜互动来进行，具体的内容还需要玩家进行脑补补充。至少这个故事是完整清晰的，玩家需要唤醒月球上的机械骑士（颇具机械迷城风格）去击败黑化了的反派。作为主角道具的小喇叭贯穿整个主线游戏。
在《Samorost 3》整个游戏流程中，游戏的音效搭配可圈可点，这归功于邀请了知名作曲家 Floex 来为其量身打造了一系列的音乐，每个场景音乐的搭配恰到好处。游戏解谜的开展也与音乐有关联，通过点击和拖曳来完成物品的交互，将喇叭拉动到环形图案上会出现音符，或是按逻辑给画片排序完成一个完整的故事。解谜难度并不是很高，也没有一个变化的难度曲线。

[h1]故事的最后[/h1]
三年磨一剑，这部雕琢三年的《Samorost 3》还是带来十足的惊喜。追求高质量的美学感官，这趟银河的历程与其说是游戏更像一部充满着幻想色彩的电影。清新灵动的配乐，精致细腻的画面，各种千奇百怪和奇思妙想应该是最好的评价。

——写于2017年10月21日

Очень приятная игра. В ней нет никакой суеты: нет необходимости убегать от злодеев или догонять их, нет квестов на время - вас никто не торопит. Приятная графика и замечательная музыка позволяют рассматривать эту игру еще и как искуство, творчество. Хочется отдельно отметить отсутствие какой либо речи как устной, так и письменной (за исключением  звуков, заменяющих речь героев, и текста в тирах).
  Игра скорее всего покажется унылой фанатам шутеров, гонок и прочим любителям экшена. Однако, она может понравится тем, кто любит музыку, грезет о путешествиях или жить не может без звездного неба.
  Так или иначе рекомендую проект Samorost 3 от Amanita Design к ознакомлению.

Les décors et la réalisation sont incroyablement beaux, on a envie de tendre la main pour effleurer les planètes chitineuses et les arbres poreux.

La musique est entêtante et on lève de temps en temps le doigt de la souris pour écouter le chant en harmonique de quelques monstres mélomanes.

La narration est très bonne, malgré l'apparente naïveté. Je ne suis pas spécialement sensible aux ambiances gnangnantes mais j'ai été surpris moi-même de me laisser entrainé par cet univers zen et onirique.

La difficulté est très bien dosée, avec une progression simple et un système d'aide pour ne pas rester bloquer bêtement. J'avoue être resté 10min au premier lancement à comprendre les premiers principes du jeu, mais passé cette phase de découverte, les puzzles s'enchainent avec bonheur.

Pour conclure, un petit jeu qui cache un gros travail et une énorme sincérité.

Une pépite !!

36155038.review: A display of beautiful artwork and music, ultimately let down by extremely bad gameplay. I bought the game on sale for cheap, but even then, I'm having trouble justifying the amount of time I'm spending for what I'm experiencing. The game consists of many, impressive pieces of artwork, which someone appears to have rather hastily thrown into a 2-D game creation suite and tried to make puzzles around. Animations are jagged and robotic, navigation is akward, and the only true physics objects are horrible beige lines that have no detail at all, and look like someone drew on the artwork with MS Paint. The puzzles often mean either pixel-hunting or memory games, with a little actual problem solving thrown in later on in the game. As a result, if you're someone not particularly good at picking out little details like I am, you'll find yourself often opening up the journal to find hints as to what to do next. Unfortunately, apart from having to solve what turns into an extremely dull puzzle to get to the journal in the first place, it tends to point out only the most obvious aspects of what you're supposed to do, without going into any detail or even a written explanation. By this point, it might seem obvious to open up a walkthrough, and keep switching tabs to that every so often. By that point, however, I might as well have not bought the game at all, and have just watched a youtube walkthrough. In fact, that's how I'd reccomend playing this game. Look up a full, silent-player walkthrough on youtube, and enjoy the art and music without any of the actual, awful game. Disclaimer: did not finish game. Decided to watch walkthrough instead when getting hopelessly stuck for the fourth time on the wooden log level.

I'm pretty much half-way between thumbs up and thumbs down on this.

36036707.review:
[h1]Short version: 82%[/h1]
Like all games from Amanita, Samorost 3 relies on its stunning presentation and non-verbal communication. The hand-drawn alien landscapes look gorgeous and the point ‘n’ click puzzles lack all kinds of written or spoken text, letting the players immerse themselves in this world of great imagination.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Amanita Design is famous for their fantasy-rich adventure games, where the imagination is always a more important aspect in creating entire alien worlds than any kind of plausibility. Therefore, Samorost 3 may be a sequel, but it is still a unique world anyone can enjoy.

Unlike most Amanita games, Samorost 3 has a defined storyline, one that revolves around the concept of musical harmony. It starts with the gnome we met in the previous Samorost titles finding a mysterious flute fallen from the sky, and throughout his journey, we learn how important harmony can be, as we travel form planet to planet, mending the wounds left on these strange ecosystems by a rogue musician monk.

The lack of text, as usual, can be a big obstacle for those who are not used to Anamita games, but luckily, most of the plot-related puzzles are straightforward or require basic trial and error. (Finding the secrets… well, that is a different story.) The rudimentary physics engine’s role in some puzzles may hold a few surprises though.
Still, in the end, the gameplay is just a means to an end: an end to take in the stunning scenery and to enjoy the simple, yet somehow deep story until we finally guide the little gnome home for some well-earned rest—both for him and for us—after a job well done.

35584540.review:
[h1]Puzzles for jerks[/h1]
The puzzles in this game are simple. So simple that there is hardly any explanation as to how the mechanics of them work.

The first set of puzzles was simple, find all the space ship pieces and give it to the crazy who just wanted to be left alone. He builds you a shiny flying onion and off to space you go! I was hoping that you would get to explore space a bit. Find a few planets, see what kinds of puzzles they had. My hopes were smashed soon when the game only gave me one place to go.

As I had feared, every planet needs to be solved in sequence in order to go to the next. This is explained buy your space onion having the battery life of potato. Given that I have never met a Faster Than Light capable vegetable, I shouldn't be so surprised.

Despite the first puzzle being a fetch quest the game does have enjoyable sounds, music and artwork. I would say a lot of love was put into this onion. I found myself retriggering some scenes to hear the musical score once more.

The puzzles are still frustratingly dumb. An example would be the puzzle that made me stop play the game. While exploring the level you will be shown some symbols almost as a micro-reward for exploring. Then as another exploration reward you literally walk into a room that is a combination lock. While at this point in the game it should be clear that is what was coming next. What was unclear was how to get the game to acknowledge that I put in the symbols.

Unsure I kept walking back and forth between two different sections of the level until I decided to write this review about the puzzle that drove me to the point of not wanting to play this game.

Other then that it was a nice game.

35457549.review:
This game explains the story of a guy dressed in white whom is obssesed with going to other planets, that suddenly a vuvuzela drops from the sky and into his dog's mouth. And thus is how the magic adventure of going to other planets discovering it's secrets, and learning the story of why you have to fight the monk who controles a big flying mecha three-headed dragon by inserting in the head of the Big Mecha Robot the big black ball to control them all so the two mechas can fight each other so you return to the Vuvuzela Monks their home and vuvuzelas so they can play for all eternity.

Jokes aside, the game is really pretty and fun but, it has it's downs. 
Pros:
If you like point and click adventures with puzzles, this game is really good.
It's pretty.
The soundtrack is great.
Mechanically is fun.
The animations, enviroments, actions, etc are really polished.
Cons:
It's a little bit short, even if you go for 100% completion.
Some of it's puzzles are uncoherent, and may get a little bit fustrating at times for it's lack of specification of what you have to do first. An example of this is that, at one point, you'll find yourself needing to re-direct the flow of water onto the jar you just re-builded but, when you reach there, there are two monkies taking baths, it doesn't explain you that you can grab the tubes nor it makes a slight difference betwen the tubes you can grab and those who don't.

Now, let's be objective, the price is 20€ (I won't bother doing the currency change) for a 4-5-6 hours of gameplay, is it really worth it? It depends on what you valore most of a purchase, do you think about the guys who created the game are an indie development team whom probably will need the money more so they can keep following their dreams and that, the experience this product offers is enough for you to be satisfied with the ammount of money you've spent or, you preffer longer content at the lowest price? I can't answer this question but, what I can tell is my opinion. What I see is a great game and a wonderfull experience, and I would gladly pay those 20€ if I didn't found this masterpice (in my opinion) in a bundle for 5 euros. But in the end, it depends on you, if you don't want to pay those 20€ but you want to experience the game, then wait untill a steam sales and buy it cheaper, or even better, get the Amanita bundle and you'll get more games like this one. In the end, the game is good.

35456247.review:
Played this together with my five year old son, of a genre I'd normally not tend to play, and it was a fabulous encounter.  Wonderful artwork/animation and excellent music that's got the warm sound of real instruments rather than cheap synthetic babble that's so often used in games like this.  The music's there because it needs to be, and it involves itself in the story, feeding that narrative that's entirely wordless.

Puzzles vary from the hard to the trivial [with no risk of getting truly stuck because of the help system], but the whole experience was enchanting, pretty much the whole way through.  Simple enough that a five year old can explore ideas, and succeed with some if not all of the puzzles, but can still enjoy the ones that are too hard to complete.  If I'm going to be at all negative it's that it was too short, as we'd really like to have carried on going.

Thanks Amanita!

Samorhost 3

Отличный Point'n'Click квест. Ходим по планетам отгадываем загадки. 
Игра погружает в себя благодаря визуальному и звуковику ряду. Часть загадок головоломок основаны на звуковом восприятии. Многие из них так сразу с ходу не пройти, но в игре есть книга с подсказками :-).
 Игра на пару тройку вечеров, но не скажу, что короткая. Для меня в самый раз, длиннее не надо. Местами все очень растянуто и не торопливо и это под конец уже начинает напрягать. 
Ачивки на внимательность и любознательность, нет таких что надо что-то сделать 100500 раз. Зато есть те которые можно получить после определенной последовательности не по сюжетной линии. 
Сюжет не замысловатый, даже скорее простоват, но подходит к игре. 
Игра атмосферная без внятного текста все восприятие, общение в виде звуков и образов. Приятный арт дизайн локаций, местами претендующий на сюрреалистическую экспозицию в  арт галерее. 

По мне цена завышена, но со скидкой брать можно.

35032584.review:
This is not a point-and-click adventure game. Like Botanicula, it's a hidden object game in disguise. What made Machinarium so great was that it adhered a defined ruleset, where objects could only be manipulated if they were within arm's reach of Josef. In that sense, it was a true point-and-click - you guided a little character around with clicks, and used his body to manipulate the environment.

Not so in Botanicula and Samorost 3. In these games, YOU are the one in control of the environment, very often without any need for your character to be anywhere near whatever it is you are trying to control. You just tell your little buddy to run to a new area, then click all over the place until you find the little hidden context-sensitive regions of the screen that you can interact with to solve the puzzle. I'd say over 50% of the puzzles in Samorost 3 do not require Gnome to actually touch anything himself.

Thumbs down. Not a true point-and-click. And that's a shame, because Machinarium is one of the best ever made. Amanita, stop making hidden object games. They aren't fun.

I do NOT play puzzle games at all. Matter of fact, I stay away from them like the plague.
Furthermore, point and click games make me want to jump off a bridge.

But I have never been so delighted to play a puzzle/point and click game like I have been whilst playing this work of art.

This game is fucking astounding, from the gorgeous visuals and lovable characters, to the serene atmosphere. This game truly is a masterpiece, and I am looking forward to spending more time in this incredible universe. I went into this game expecting one of the worst experiences, considering my distaste for both puzzle and point and click games. I have never been so pleasently surprised while playing a video game than I have with this... this... amazing work of art.

I was so confused at first, wandering around, not knowing what in the hell to do. But slowly I began to learn, I began to care about the characters and their interactions, slowly being charmed by the wonderful art style and game design. It's fascinating and enjoyable to discover your own way around certain obstacles. I've only spent an hour playing this, but it is so gorgeous that I had to leave a review.

I never played Samorost 1 or 2, but let me tell you, this gem is one that you cannot afford to miss out on.

Truly a heartwarming experience for any gamer out there. Well worth your money, believe me.

34766009.review:
A Amanita Design é famosa por jogos fofos, cativantes e criativos. Assim como Machinarium, Botanicula e as outras duas entradas da série Samorost, [b]Samorost 3[/b] consegue novamente ser tudo isso.

Na série Samorost, você controla um viajante espacial, que vai de planeta em planeta descobrindo povos, faunas e ambientes totalmente novos. Como já explorado em outros jogos da Amanita Design, a aventura é um point'n'click que se comunica de uma forma inteiramente não verbal com o jogador. Na jogabilidade, isso é ótimo, sendo traduzido por animações simples em balões de diálogo. Já nos menus é um ponto negativo do jogo, já que a simbologia pode não ser clara o suficiente muitas vezes para salvar e carregar o jogo, por exemplo, gerando a perda de dados.

Tirando esse pequeno detalhe de design, o resto do jogo não peca no que veio trazer: um universo inteiramente criativo para se aventurar e transitar entre planetas. Com uma arte que mescla uma composição de imagens realistas e desenhos a mão, a aventura fica imersiva e carismática. Isso tudo aliado com a jogabilidade envolvendo quebra-cabeças musicais, sendo que o casamento constante de música e aspectos visuais fazem de Samorost 3 uma aventura bastante sinestésica.

Quem gostou de Machinarium, Botanicula ou dos antigos Samorost terá diversão garantida com esse jogo. Sendo assim, prepare seu fone de ouvido e explore o espaço inusitado, surpreendente e meio surrealista de Samorost 3.

34679815.review:
Well, I bought this game in a bundle, so I'm pretty sure I'm not the targeted audience but I nevertheless want to share my opinion, especially after seeing those 100% positive reviews.

First the Graphics which are praised by many really didnt do it for me. I can see the individuality in the art style but i genuinly got disgusted by it. All those freaky, hairy and lumpy things just didnt appeal to me. I couldnt find the charm in clicking on insects and watching some creepy shimpanses bath. 
Furthermore i found it difficult to actually distinguish relevant from irrelevant spots, to the point where i missed an entire screen because i didnt anticipate that i can walk through a wall of space mushrooms.

The music is relaxing and since there is no voice acting you need to concentrate on, the sound design creates a feeling of smoothness. But the gibberish they talk got somrwhat annoying and some sound effects like the "barking" dog sounded cheap to me.

I have no idea what to say about the story. Firstly because i havent played far, secondly because most of the time you just travel from one seemingly unrelated surreal background to another while clicking on everything hoping it starts an interaction or at best an animation bubble. At least that's what i did.
I guess there has been a planet eating squid you chase on your do it yourself space craft built out of a bathtub but who am i to know. Definitely nothing that kept me on the edge of my seat, let alone wanted me to find out more.

Finally the puzzles. Well most of the time you simply follow the instructions often given through an unskipable animation you have to watch multiple times to really get. 
There are those trial and error moments, but nothing unfair. The integrated help, kind of hidden in the simplistic menu interface approach which at first was quite confusing, is lovingly designed and keeps you from wasting to much time, when all you missed is an item from a totally different place.
So they were okay, while one particular card/animation puzzle was really entertaining and positively stood out.
But i missed some real logical challenges.

All in all this is not a bad game, but nothing i would recommend and definitely not a game that should have only positive reviews. It lacks the wit of grim fandango, monkey island or sam and max and doesnt provide a challenge like myst.
Then again i dont think it wants to play in that league.

[b] Hermoso, gracioso y relajante [/b] 
3 palabras que describen a la perfección Samorost 3. 

Si te decepciono Samorost 2 por su escasa duracion ( [i] vamos que 10 minutos los dura [/i] ) y te sientes indeciso con su secuela, temiendo que al igual que el anterior, te abandone justo cuando te empiezas a encariñar con su universo, dejame decirte que no hay que temer, pues Samorost 3 a pesar de no ser un juego largo en si, es un juego que dura lo que tiene que durar.

Los creadores de machinarium lo han vuelto a hacer, han logrado capturar mi atencion de principio a fin y me han dejado esa "experiencia", la cual pocos juegos logran dejar actualmente, pues si bien hay muchos juegos entretenidos alla afuera, pocos logran dejarte una "experiencia". 

Su dificultad es baja y su duración puede rondar las 4 horas ( [i] a no ser que te entretengas como yo lo hice [/i] ) pero a pesar de esos "contras" el  juego merece el titulo de [b] JOYA [/b], pues el hecho de que no sea dificil no necesariamente significa que sea aburrido o que no puedas atorarte en algun lugar ( [i]  A B C, AB C para quien lo entienda [/i] ) y como dije anteriormente su duracion es la indicada, el juego tal y como esta es perfecto, logra su objetivo, deleitar tus oidos, tus ojos y tu mente con su encanto. 

Lo recomiendo al 100% junto con el soundtrack, pero de igual forma aconsejo comprarlo en oferta al mismo precio que su compañero machinarium, pues 20 dolares puede resultar excesivo.

34650683.review:
One of the best indi games I've played in a looooong time. The art, sound, and overall concept, are unique and original, instead of the plethora of copy\paste trash that plagues the industry. From the second you start playing you know that the devs put all their heart and effort into perfecting the game. I came into this never playing the first two Samorost games, but it didn't matter. 

Instantly the art\animations jumped right out at me, and appreciated how detailed thier hand drawn, 2D world looked. Textures are crisp, models are intracately shaped, and every location is unique and detailed to the very last pixel. There is NO copy\paste in any of these scenes, which is pretty amazing. The "2.5D" art style adds a ton of depth to the scenes. Every time I'd switch to a new zone, I would move closer to my screen, trying to pick out every little detail.

The sound design instantly stood out as well, it is truely unique. While it's typical to build the sound around the setting; in Samorost, the setting is built around the sound as well. Most (if not all) puzzles are designed around audio and visual cues to help you solve them. Once you do, random sounds will combine to form musical "riffs" to form a flowing track.

Aside from the ambient music track, all of the sounds are voiced. They are made with a series of mumbles, coos, and grunts that create every sound. The ambient music was soothing yet haunting, calm but upbeat. Very hard to describe, but it helped set the mood even further.

The only con I had was some of the transitions between locations takes a little long, but it gives you more time to appreciate the hard work that must have went into this game for such a small team.

The game gave me ~8 hrs of play to complete the story and collect all of the achievements (I did use a guide to collect a few). There isn't really any replay value, but the game delivered 100% of it's value (for me) in the time I got out of it.

If you have ANY interest in the genre, then you need to play this game. I bought it on sale, but I would have easily paid full price.

9.5\10

34635564.review:
A masterpiece, in many senses.

I'm not normally a fan of [i]Point and Click[/i] games, but Amanita Designs are masterful at creating them, and this game is no exception. In fact, it's quickly become my favourite!

The game radiates charm and wonder and the puzzles are great - not too difficult or simple, and not requiring too much or too little effort. This game is a great time waster, though I'd hardly call time playing it "wasted".

[h1]Pros[/h1]
Stunning visuals, mesmerising sounds, and a fantastic and unique soundtrack by one of my favourite musicians: [i][url=https://soundcloud.com/floex]Floex[/url][/i] And his music isn't just limited to the background - many elements of the game affect it and vice-versa.

It also features great level design, splitting the game into multiple worlds so that any backtracking between puzzles is shorter distances within the same world. Gameplay is well suited for people of all ages, and may even lend itself better to younger audiences, because it rewards imagination a little more than it does intelligence.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
None so far. I'd like it if the animations were a little smoother, but this limitation is probably down to how the game is made - quite literally with hand drawn/painted elements.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
I'd recommend this game to anyone looking for a relaxing game that still makes use of your brain cells. It's great to play alone or with company (as I plan to with my girlfriend). Combine your intellect and observation power!

And if you're unsure about Point and Click games, then this might be the one to win you over. Just wait for a sale and give it a go. I promise that it won't disappoint.

34361677.review:
This is one of the best feeling games I’ve played in a while. It just really brings a unique and lovely feel in an industry filled with AAA titles and games that just don’t feel like they were really cared for and used only as a money-making tool. This game feels like the devs put in the time and decided they would rather have a wonderful game than something that would be more marketable. Now I’ll start the main part of the review. 

The sounds and music in this game are some of the best I’ve seen. First the soundtrack really draws you in and makes the game 100% more enjoyable. The devs also spared nothing when it comes to "voice acting" and sound effects. They give the characters life and a kind of mystery as well as creating a magical environment. This and the music really make the feel of the game much more relaxed and interesting. Most or every creature and "person" (if you can call them that) has something to say when it/they are interacted with, creating an in-depth environment that draws you in and makes you feel like a part of the little world.

 Now we move into the art style of the game. First if you don’t enjoy this art you’re not going to enjoy the game nearly as much as it can be enjoyed. With that out of the way I’ll go into my opinion (because I know how much you wana hear it). I personally love the art and the characters wouldn’t be nearly as charming without the beautiful design of the game. Every area seems like a moving and living photo that you can interact with and traverse. The creatures of the game also have a very interesting look and will usually stand out from the terrain but not to a point where they look out of place. In fact, most of the creature’s match flawlessly with the place that they dwell and have a fitting "personality" for what they look like and where they live. [b]I [/b]really love the art and it is really a key part of the game as I see it.

The puzzle aspect of this game is somewhat lacking as most of the time they are very easy or do not have anything to do with the story or the situation. None the less they can be a lovely way to spend time and the music and art makes it so that it does not seem like your grinding. I would recommend using a guide or walkthrough to help if you’re stuck but that’s up to you and how much you want to do the game on your own. I will leave a few links to good guides and videos down below if you are looking for help. 

In all this is a wonderful game and I think it brings a type of play to the table that is very refreshing and magical. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who is interested in the art and music/sound effects of the game. I picked it up on sale for around $10 or maybe $7 USD and don’t regret one penny. I hoped this review helped you and gave you an idea of what this game entails.

34201640.review:
This is a game about tiny things that has a big heart.

[i]Samorost 3[/i] is also about music, kindness, and quiet attention. Honestly, calling it a puzzle game is somewhat of an overstatement, because the puzzles are often illogical (like, say, to have a bunch of imps brew a bomb for you, you need to make them sing in sync... which obviously has nothing to do with brewing). It's more like an interactive screensaver, a meditation that throws a screen full of [i]things[/i] at you and suggests you just mess with them somewhat randomly.

So you get to ride hairy asteroids, pluck moths' antennae, feed giant anteaters, climb termitary holes, and so much more. The plot is rudimentary; this is the story of a gnome-like guy who is attentive enough to hear the music hidden from mundane ears—and when he reproduces it with his small trumpet, magic happens.

Turns out the world is eager to be witnessed—you just need to know how to look.

This must have also been the philosophy that went into making the game. It's precisely due to the creators' shrewd and kind way of looking at things that the numerous creatures they've made turned out so lovely. They're not cute in an exaggerated way! But you're made to care for them due to how well their mannerisms are reproduced or lovingly exaggerated, like a dog making several circles in place before going to sleep, a chamois being tender and easily frightened like an insect, or a nuthatch being Determined Like An Arrow.

The collage-like visuals are impeccable, and the sound design is simply incredible, with many ambient actions seemingly voiced by human voices, which adds to the atmosphere of a fairy tale being told. And, on top of all that, [i]Samorost 3[/i] is also aesthetically original and does not really rely on overused tropes.

A gem, all in all.

33478002.review:
Kleiner Gnom auf Abenteuer - Teil 3

Viel hat sich nicht getan, wenn man die drei Ableger von Samorost miteinander vergleicht, optisch etwas ansprechender Sound wie gehabt sehr stimmig und das übliche minimalistische Spielprinzip.

Dennoch kann ich Samorost 3 jedem Freund von Adventures empfehlen, es wird eine interessante Geschichte erzählt während man verschiedene Planeten und Monde bereist.
Der übliche Samorost-Charme von Amanita Design ist eben so vorhanden, wie die herrlich abstrakten Gebiete und die abwechslungsreiche Musik.

Gepaart mit der simplen Ein-Klick-Steuerung, der Tröte und nahezu keinem Inventar fallen einige Rätsel zwar recht einfach aus, andere, insbesondere einige der Achievements, sind ordentliche Kopfnüsse.
Aber man wird liebevoll von Geistern und Personen durch bildhafte Gedankenblasen an die Probleme herangeführt, sollte man dennoch einmal nicht weiter wissen, hilft einem eine integrierte Lösung in Form eines magischen Buches weiter.
Hier kann man für jedes Gebiet separat die Lösung einsehen, nachdem man ein einfaches Schieberätsel gelöst hat - sehr angenehm und äußerst passend in das Spiel integriert.

Aufgelockert wird der Adventureteil durch viele anklickbare Sachen von denen einige auch Achievements (sowohl Ingame als auch für Steam) enthalten.
Für diese und andere Erfolge führt der Protagonist, der kleine weißebekleidete Samorost-Zwerg einen niedlichen Freudentanz auf.
Generell tanzt er sehr gerne, denn an einigen Stellen im Spiel lassen sich - Samorost-typisch - auch Musikstücke hervorzaubern, wenn man zum Beispiel eine Gruppe Höhlenbewohner in der korrekten Reihenrolge anklickt.
In bester Saturday Night Fever Manier zeigt der kleine Mann, das ein echter John Travolta in ihm steckt.

Einziger Wehrmutstropfen ist die kurze Spielzeit.

9/10 kleiner Zwerg ganz groß

Samorost 3 überzeugt mich voll und ganz. Story, Storytelling, Design, Sounddesign in jede Ecke dieses Spiels scheint unglaublich viel Liebe und kunstfertigkeit geflossen zu sein.

33388376.review:
A mani basse il miglior titolo degli Amanita design. Ambientazione eccezionale, musica eccezionale, rompicapi e puzzle nella media, una storia semplice e la sensazione di star compiendo una piccola grande impresa.
La cosa che merita una menzione particolare è l'immaginario ben riuscito: è rilassante e confortante vedere vita che pullula in piccole zolle di terra, oggetti e rifiuti, sperduti nella gelida immensità dello spazio, vera e propria fantascienza fiabesca!
In questa saga ho colto leggere ispirazioni ai lavori di Giger e Moebius, due artisti che mi stanno particolarmente a cuore.
Il primo ed il secondo capitolo sono storie a parte (neanche lontanamente ben sviluppate come questa) che riguardano il piccolo folletto, e a parte un piccolo easter egg non c'è nessun collegamento.

33315702.review:
From the first moment I played Botanicula, I held it close to my heart as my favorite Amanita and, overall, one of my favorite games. Half of that was completely obliterated by playing Samorost 3; Botanicula is still a personal favorite, but Samorost 3 reached such a sky-high baseline in character development, design, art direction, voice acting, music, storytelling and gameplay, that my heart has no response other than to cater it even closer than it already did Botanicula.

Amanita Design outdid themselves with this gem of a game, going beyond the already superb heights they reached with their previous works of art.

With a charming flute-playing character as its lead and a universe to explore, Samorost 3 takes its players through a gorgeous and heartfelt adventure towards inner and outer recovery. What begins as a quest to build a ship escalates into an epic battle of colossi orchestrated by coincidences big and small. Like all other Amanita games, the puzzles are not tough to solve and the achievements are a delight to strive for — and do actually add to the story! The whole that Samorost 3 forms is one of charm and charisma without excluding tense moments and a touching finale.

In conclusion, I couldn't recommend Samorost 3 more. Its amazing story, its gorgeous views and its outstanding sound work make it not only one of the casual puzzle games I love the most, but also one of the best I've ever played.

PS: If you, like me, fell in love with this game, check out Floex's "Samorost3 Pre​-​Remixes EP (Free DWNLD)" at Bandcamp.

33243103.review:
Samorost 3 is a great puzzle game with a very atmospheric gameplay. There is no understandable language in-game and everything is understandable in its picturized language. I have played  Machinarium before and this one was easier but had a better atmosphere and the tasks throughout the game were easier to understand but didnt make the game too easy. I recommend to turn the volume up and enjoy the game! 

Pros:
- atmospheric
- easy controls
- challenging puzzles but not too difficult
- the hints are accessable if you cant figure out a solution
- well-paced

Cons:
- I recommend saving a couple of times during your playthrough, because there is a gamebreaking instance during a puzzle (the one with the seeds and petals)

7.5/10

33235246.review: Beautiful design and really unique puzzles

33229331.review:
I bought this game mostly because of all the positive reviews and because I really liked most games that these developers put out in the past, and believe me, I really really really want to like this game. There's obviously a lot of love put into the audiovisual design of the game and in a way I'd almost recommend it simply to support the art designers/composers/animators etc. 

BUT- And saying this almost makes me sad - to me Samorost 3 completely fails as a puzzle game. First of all most puzzles are either painfully obvious (NPCs will literally show you an animation of the exact thing you are supposed to do) or so random that you can easily end up getting stuck randomly clicking around the screen until something triggers or you have to resort to either a walkthrough or the ingame guide that the game offers instead of a decent hint system in the sense of offering you slight nudges in the right direction when you get stuck. This is pretty frustrating on the long run there's barely any sense of actual accomplishment within the actual gameplay, and if design is the only selling point of a game, then to me there's barely any difference between "playing it yourself" and watching a lets play on youtube. 

Like most steam reviews this is just an opinion, and if it differs from yours, that's wonderful. I'm happy that other people can enjoy this game as much as they do. I really wish I could enjoy it more.

진정한 의미의 힐링게임

플레이 시간 : 3.8시간 (사실 체감시간은 이것보다 더 길다. 게임의 진행이 대체로 여유롭기 때문.)

가성비 : 보통 (게임 시간은 가격에 비해서 많이 떨어지지만 너무 편안하고 여유있게 게임을 해서 시간이 부족하다는 느낌은 안들었습니다.)

몰입도 : 다소 높음 (그러나 이 게임을 켠왕하려고 한다면 몸이 좀 지칠 것이다. 그러니 여유롭게 끊어서 하자)

난이도 : 낮음 (정말 친절하다. 눌러야하는 것도 쉽게 알려주고 거기다 공략집까지 게임 내에 들어있다.)

현재까지 했던 포인트 앤 클릭 게임 중에서 가장 친절하다. 게임 내에 공략집이 들어있고 게임 자체도 해야할 일을 알기쉽게 설명해준다. 사모로스트 2와는 아주 비교된다. (사모로스트2는 정말 불친절하다)

진정한 의미의 힐링게임. 포인트 앤 클릭 방식의 게임은 자칫하면 오히려 깊은 빡침을 불러오는 경우가 허다한데 이 게임은 게임 자체가 친절해서 스토리와 배경, 그리고 음악까지 음미할 수 있다. 이 삼박자가 어우러진 분위기는 힐링게임으로서 가히 최고라고 할 수 있다.

33082146.review:
Samorost 3 really gets me with it's wierdness, amazing graphics and incredible sound design.

It's a point and click adventure game about little gnome who found an instrument which allows to well... I think to see the desires and histories of Items. I really like puzzles in this game. I'm not a huge fan of old, or oldschool type of P&C puzzles. You know, hundreds of items in your inventory and trying to use everything on everything. Puzzles are mostly based around some levers (but those are really creatively done!), sounds etc.
Asthetically, it's totally amazing. It has really great quality in terms of visuals, but also whole artstyle is beautiful, just look at the screenshots, design of places is wierd and it gives really great charm to it. It's also cute at some moments, especially with protagonist voice. Locations are also pretty interactive.

Sound is really good, whole game is kinda based around sounds and it's doing great job. Music is just amazing, Floex nailed it again! 

For storyline, it's simple, it's nothing really deep, but it's doing it's job. It's just a little story with cute protagonist, I have nothing against it.

Overall It's really great game if you look for casual P&C game with great and wierd design and amazing audiovisuals. 
It's pretty short (probably will take you like 4-6 hours), but definetly worth the money.

32826819.review:
Samorost 3 es un nuevo viaje al original universo estético que nos ofrece Amanita Design y del que ya pudimos disfrutar en los dos capítulos previos de la saga, en Botanicula o en Machinarium. La aventura es el point & click habitual al que nos tienen acostumbrados el estudio checo, donde el protagonista recibe retazos del argumento y va avanzando en la aventura mediante la interacción con los objetos del entorno. Y es ahí, en el diseño del entorno, donde el juego destaca principalmente.

Poco se puede decir del estética preciosista que destilan todas las producciones de Amanita Design. Si alguien no la conoce, ya está tardando en jugar a los juegos del estudio, seguro que no se arrepentirá. La atracción que ejerce en el jugador esa mezcla de dibujo y miniatura, tremendamente detallada y con claras influencias surrealistas es, sin duda, su punto fuerte. Uno se podría pasar horas disfrutando de todos y cada uno de los elementos que configuran los distintos paisajes que ofrece Samorost 3. Es sin duda es un disfrute para la vista.

Del mismo modo, la música juega un papel fundamental en el juego. No solo por la sutileza de los sonidos y las piezas musicales, sino porque en Samorost 3 es una herramienta de comunicación y un hilo argumental. A pesar de haberlo visto en más juegos, no deja de sorprenderme la facilidad que tiene Amanita Design para transmitir sin necesidad de palabras. Manejan con una facilidad pasmosa la mezcla de imágenes y sonidos para transmitir no solo el argumento o la mecánica del juego, sino también las emociones de los personajes. Es sin duda otra muestra del buen gusto y la calidad que destilan todas las producciones del estudio.

Sin embargo no todo es perfecto en Samorost 3. También tiene fallos, y no son pocos.

El desarrollo del juego es completamente lineal lo que por un lado se agradece —pues no existe un modo rápido de moverse por escenarios/planetas ya recorridos—, pero por otro deja una impresión de historia desaprovechada. La interacción con los objetos es complicada en algunas ocasiones, no sabiendo si lo estás haciendo bien o no. La duración total es excesivamente corta, y la dificultad baja. Esto es especialmente sangrante en los últimos “planetas” que te dejan con una profunda sensación de ¿esto es todo? Parece incluso que hubieran tenido que simplificar el juego y terminarlo antes de tiempo para cumplir con algún plazo. Y la dificultad de los puzles tampoco es para tirar cohetes. No quiero decir con esto que tengan que ser rompecabezas imposibles, pero un mayor desafío se agradecería —sabiendo además que existe un solucionario dentro del juego—. Aunque también es justo decir que, a pesar de su moderada dificultad, algunos de los puzles son tremendamente originales. Algo similar pasa con el acceso al solucionario, cuya dificultad es tan baja que te hace preguntar porque no han permitido consultarlo directamente, sin juego de por medio.

Y luego están los logros. Porque sí, uniéndose a la moda de todos los juegos actuales —moda que muy a mi pesar ya estrenaron en Botanicula— buena parte del juego trata de resolver pequeños puzles sin influencia en la historia para obtener los dichosos logros. Algún día alguien me tendrá que explicar el porqué de esta nueva práctica que incorporan todos los juegos actuales, pero yo al menos preferiría menos logros y más historia. 

Pero no nos quedemos solo con las cosas negativas. El argumento es sencillo y agradable, los bocetos in game (tanto del solucionario como de los libros argumentales) son preciosos, el protagonista es muy simpático (aunque no llegan a destilar el carisma del robot de Machinarium), y el resto de personajes tan peculiares y disfrutables como siempre (con la excepción de los cuatro monjes que terminan siendo algo decepcionantes).

Creo que el mayor problema de Samorost 3 es el mismo que tenía su anterior juego, y ese problema se llama Machinarium. Con Machinarium el estudio rozó casi la perfección y cualquier otro juego, por comparación, termina saliendo mal parado. En cualquier caso, y como también concluí con Botanicula, la compra de este juego es muy recomendable, no solo porque tiene numerosos aspectos que se podrán disfrutar, sino porque de este modo Amanita Design podrá seguir ofreciendo sus cuidadas producciones que son un soplo de aire fresco entre tanto triple A.

I got this game during the steam summer sale, so I paid less than $10. That said, I still found it to be very short. (I finished the story in just under 5 hours) 

The visuals are great, there are some great sound effects, and the maps are very cool, but I was expecting there to be more of them.

The puzzles are fun for the most part, but there are a few where you just have to guess at what you're supposed to do. The game has a hint system, but if you look at the hint it tells you the whole solution in so much detail that you are basically just clicking through the steps to reach the next area.

After finishing the story I doubt I will ever launch this game again. 

Bottom line: if you like short puzzle games pick this game up on sale.

Почему стоит играть:
+ Фотографичная фактура поверхностей. Уровни напоминают больше коллажи из обрезков фотографий. Графические дизайнеры и художники оценят это элемент.
+ Очаровательный игровой мир, сочетающий в себе стимпанк, этнику и биомеханику.
+ Дизайн окружения и арт.
+ Анимационные ролики, нарисованные вручную.
+ Превосходное музыкальное сопровождение, прекрасно сочетающееся с игровым миром, выполненное в самых разных жанрах. Тут и этника, классика, немного тяжёлого рока и акапельное исполнение.

Почему не стоит играть:
- Несколько завышенная цена. Игра конечно крайне замечательная, но также и очень короткая, чтобы за неё просить столько денег.
- Очень малая продолжительность. Игра легко проходится часа за три.
- Довольно странное отношение к головоломкам. К большинству из них нет никаких подсказок, вписанных в игровой мир. Понять их логику можно только воспользовавшись внутриигровым помощником, что немного рушит атмосферу.

32345044.review:
Après plus de dix ans d’absence, le jeu d’aventure intergalactique qui fonda Amanita Design revient plus en forme que jamais. Visuellement bluffant, musicalement impeccable, Samorost 3 nous plonge pendant cinq à six heures dans un monde lointain et follement inventif. Méritant de prime abord une note maximale, le titre est pourtant terni par un gameplay imparfait. Essayant de singer Machinarium tout en restant fidèle à son esprit contemplatif, le jeu reste assis entre deux chaises et nous sert des phases de puzzle trop souvent obtuses ou répétitives. Pour autant il est difficile de ne pas terminer ce Samorost 3 d’une traite, ne serait-ce que pour voir quel panorama et quelles sonorités nous réserve le prochain tableau. En définitive, on reste sur notre faim ; non pas parce qu’il manque quelque chose, mais parce qu’on en veut plus – et c’est généralement bon signe.

[h1] + Points positifs [/h1]
[list]
[*] Les illustrations impressionnantes
[*] La bande-son somptueuse
[*] Une ambiance qui vous transporte
[*] Un storytelling singulier et efficace
[*] Un monde fourmillant de détails
[*] Pas besoin d'avoir joué à Samorost 1 et 2
[/list]

[h1] - Points négatifs [/h1]
[list]
[*] Beaucoup de répétitions, d’allers-retours
[*] Plusieurs énigmes fastidieuses
[*] Se termine assez rapidement
[*] Un prix un poil salé
[/list]

31929082.review:
A beautiful and magical experience from Amanita Design. They are incapable of making a bad game, and Samarost 3 is probably their best one yet. It's a gentle, non-violent and playful game of exploration, wonder and puzzle solving, starring an inquisitive little gnome who wanders wide-eyed (or so it seems) around imaginatively-designed little planetoids that are full of eclectic life. It's cartoon realism, and all the better for it. Everything is infused with so much character, from little incidental details to the tiny animals that scurry around and make curious squeaking noises if you try and interact with them. There's such an innocent sense of humour running through the entire game, it's the perfect escape from the world.

Although the artwork is stunning - I'd describe it as photorealistically unrealistic - music infuses the entire game. Much of the time you interact with the world using a flute, prompted by a visual cue that appears as you explore or solve puzzles. The world responds both visually and musically, with Floex again supplying the tunes. His work on Machinarium was great, but here it's even more closely integrated into the game. The first time you're rewarded with music after solving a puzzle, and you see the timeless reaction from your little gnome, you're almost guarnateed a huge grin. The puzzles range from fairly easy to those requiring a bit of logical deduction, but all of them felt quite logical. There's a bit of to- and fro-ing required at one point, which could have benefited from a short-cut, but it never felt like a drag.

The game ran for 7 hours, although at least an hour of that was revisiting puzzles to hear the music once more! Once you finish the game, the world doesn't go away. Instead you're given the means to roam freely around the places you've visited, and perhaps try and figure out all the achievements (all of which involve finding ways of interacting with creatures and objects).

If you want more joy in your life, Samarost 3 is highly recommended.

31911365.review:
[h1]All of Amanita Design's games are exceptionally well-crafted treasures of beautifully coherent surrealism. [url=store.steampowered.com/app/421120/Samorost_3/]Samorost 3[/url] is probably the studio's most accomplished exploration yet.[/h1]

The game's high-resolution textures and detailed scenery now look better than ever, while retaining the unique style that made its previous entries so splendidly inspired. The quality of its rich soundtrack is equally impressive, while fully original puzzles ensure there is nothing derivative about this title.

In this adventure, you won't just point and click; you must also pull and hold and interact more directly with the environment and its wonderfully unusual inhabitants. A few puzzles had me briefly glance at a hint guide for brevity but not because they lacked sense.

You play a charming little guy that goes out exploring floating microcosms in pajamas. His initial motivation is not entirely apparent but there's always a clear expected direction. All of this is intuitively achieved without words.

Your little guy gets enthusiastic when he wins achievements and dances when completing major objectives. It's the cutest way to celebrate progression in a cheerfully naive manner.

After the game's ending, players are free to roam the worlds in a sort of epilogue to complete missed and additional puzzles for extra achievements. Highly recommended.

31771169.review:
Делая обзор на эту игру, мне бы хотелось выделить ряд плюсов, так как минусов я просто не смогла обнаружить:

1. [b] Графика [/b]
Превосходная рисовка, мягкие, не режущие глаз цвета, уютные локации и живописные пейзажи - все это может порадовать, если проходишь Samorost 3, как, впрочим, и предыдущую игру данной студии - великолепный Machinarium.

2. [b] Музыка [/b]
Практически вся игра построена на различных мелодиях, звуках и просто на приятной музыке, сопровождающей локации. Как, опять же, и в Machinarium, саундтрек очень радует, их композитор, Tomas Dvorak, просто молодчина.

3. [b] Головоломки [/b]
Временами появляются игры, которые поражают своим захватывающим сюжетом, приятной атмосферой или просто уютным миром. Однако, если в таких играх имеются трудные головоломки, это может сильно повредить впечатлению, в случае если не будет получаться. В данной игре такого нет - головоломки не элементарны и не скучны, нет, однако они достаточно быстро решаются, не успевая надоесть и тем самым испортить впечатление.

4. [b] Забавные персонажи [/b]
Все герои, которые так или иначе проскальзывали на экране, вызывали у меня улыбку, что очень приятно. Забавные существа, населяющие уютные мирки данной игры, идеально дополняют ее, что нельзя не записать в плюсы. 

Графика: 10/10
Саундтрек:10/10
Сюжет: 8/10
Геймплей: 10/10

Общая оценка: 9,5/10

31170130.review:
Samorost 3:
~~~~~~~~~ 
   
Music can make you feel calm, reflective, jovial and many other sensations. But can music solve a predicament for a space gnome? You see, several of his neighbouring planets have experienced fierce attacks from the three-headed space monster. Luckily, a magic flute dropped from the Galaxy right on his doorstep! Come on guys, let’s help this space gnome in Samorost 3!

Samorost 3 is an adventure / point and click /puzzle game where you control a space gnome who has a magic flute to help him resolve puzzles.

Your character will visit five planets (including the one you start the game on) throughout this adventure. Before your cute little gnome can travel from one planet to another he has to collect specific and unconventional items to create a flying thing. 

As there is no dialogue in Samorost 3, your gnome will respond with a positive, negative or even a surprise “mmh” depending on what he is interacting with. Most of the animals and insects can be clicked on, as can the people.  Each different interaction will create a different reaction.  For instance, a bug can fall out of the tree if has been touched (poor little thing). Touch a parrot and it might sing. As your character explores the planets, he will come across some items, such as trees, holes and other characters, that will project sound waves (icons); make sure he uses his magic flute on them as they will give him important hints for solving puzzles via a small animation scene. You can refer to the book of hints (the book with the two closed eyes) for further help. To be honest with you, the puzzles are not too difficult to figure out and they are well-designed. But if you need a hand, click on the book (in the game menu) and align the red lights on its cover - it will show you what to do next. 

The artwork and the soundtrack are just sensational, in my opinion. The game runs very well and it is easy to play for all ages. I found the menu a bit confusing at first; I kicked myself out of the game by mistake, but the auto save was there to rescue my progress.
 
Positives:
~~~~~~~
 
-	Superb artworks & soundtrack
-	Nice puzzles
-	Book of hints
-	Achievement and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	A bit short

Samorost 3 is truly an amazing point and click for all ages!

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

好评原声音乐，这游戏对得起这个标签，但是我就是要给差评。
我一直很好奇为什么这种点点点游戏能称得上是解谜。何况这个游戏连谜题都没有，单纯点点点。
很多地方鼠标有变化但是和剧情需要一点都不相关而且也不触发任何特殊场景非常有误导性。
在菜单页面最左边有个书，我猜是最后用到的道具，但是一开始就给我这么一个乱七八糟的东西算什么，也一点都不应景，哪来的书，要干嘛，说好的星球旅行你又是个什么东西。
还有一些地方不用特定的方法点连所谓谜题的动画都看不到。比如如果不把乌龟背上的泡泡先点一遍提示动画都不会出来就结束了，看得我莫名其妙。同一个星球上最左边的小怪兽无限唱歌就是不推动剧情，我对照着攻略点了3遍依旧没反应。如果不能推动剧情请最起码给一些有意义的提示，什么都没有就没了，个人认为游戏性极差。
我比较喜欢这个游戏的地方在于隐藏成就开启后可以点击获得的图标组成音乐，游戏我是玩不下去了。但是我感觉这个游戏这个价格也对得起一整个ost了。我姑且理解成一个可以挂卡的原声集了。作为游戏而言，这作远不如机械迷城。虽然我依旧不喜欢点点点的游戏，不过至少机械里面有更多可以称得上是解谜的要素。
我大概只能想到一句话：看起来好看的游戏并不都是好游戏。

Samorost 3 или Чешская Нарокомания Для Любителей Квестов

Игру делали те же люди, что и Machinarium, и видимо первые две части Samorost и это видно по стилю, анимации и локациям. В процессе игры наш герой путешествует на космическом корабле собранном-из-говна-и-палок-с-помошью-кувалды-и-каккой-то-матери, и пытается победить злобного любителя кустаного алкоголя....Идиотизм, не так ли ??? Сюжет тут тоже как-то странно раскрывается, что вызывает некоторое недоумение. В общем, если Вы -любитель жанра, и играть вам натурально не во что - вперед. Остальные проходим мимо.

Повторно я в это играть не буду.
Оценка 6,5/10
