22038533.review:
[b]Samorost 3 4/5:[/b] Vesmírný pišišvor, který se učil komunikovat se světem u Krtečka a jenž by mohl být z fleku synátorem Malého Prince, se vrací a to v doposud nejvýpravnější, nejdelší (lehce přes šest hodin včetně veškerých achievementů) i nejtěžší hře v historii Amanity. Jednu věc si ujasněme hned zpočátku: nápaditější, hravější, krásnější a lépe znějící titul na Steamu nenajdete; prostě nenajdete. O tom jak moc podmanivé a "dušičku hladivé" to je, myslím zdaleka nejlépe vypovídá, že i když přes již dávno pokořené obrazovky budete procházet znovu (a to si piště že budete v některých fázích hry létat tam a sem jak čamrdy), tak se stejně po příchodu do lokace zastavíte a opět se (minimálně) pár vteřin budete kochat onou všudypřítomnou pastvou pro oči i (d)uši.
 
 Jinak je vše tak, jak by to jeden od Amanity čekal. Hravé (a to natolik, že většina achievementů je za nepovinné činnosti okolo objevování světa a možností v něm), nápadité, muzikální, bezeslovné, dojímací a okouzlující natolik, že to nenechá chladným ani toho největšího cynika. Akorát že je to jejich nejdelší i nejtěžší hra a nejsem si jist, zda je to ku prospěchu. Jakkoli to nikdy není nudné, tak přeci jen si autoři veškeré nápady vystřílejí ještě před finální planetou, kde již tak trochu mlátí prázdnou slámu. Sice nádhernou a nesporně zábavnou, ale již důkladně vymlácenou. A zároveň by tomu co délky prospěla ještě jedna větší planeta navíc; pokud by na ní tedy nechyběly nápady.

 I ta obtížnost je svým způsobem na obtíž, protože zabraňuje souvislému kochání se. Myslím že nejsem sám, kdo čeká (i chce) od Amanity něco jako "interaktivní screensaver", tak jak se jim to podařilo v Machinariu či rodinné Botanicule a nikoli místy takřka regulérní adventurní záležitost (a to říkám jako milovník klikacích adventur). Není to v žádném ohledu těžká výzva, ale úplně odpočinkové to tentokrát rovněž není. A ano, můžete se případně uchýlit k animované nápovědě (resp. takovému potrknutí), ale to už je jaksi na obtíž onomu "casual" zážitku.
 
 A pak mám na autory pifku ještě v jedné věci. Hned na začátku vám do cesty postaví jednu geniálně jednoduchou a jednoduše geniální mechaniku s vytvářením příběhů skrze rozanimované hrací karty. Totálně vás tím nadchnou a nemůžete se dočkat, až potkáte další postavu, která vás k tomu vyzve. A čekáte a čekáte... Než vám dojde, že to není nápad, ke kterému by se autoři vrátili. Což je škoda nesmírná, protože to je na úrovni toho, kdyby se lidstvo po vynálezu kola spokojilo s tím, že se točí a následně celý ten koncept zahodilo.
 
 Což i tak pranic nemění na tom, že třetí Samorost je vynikající hrou a výjimečným uměleckým počinem. Jen prostě není nejlepší hrou od Amanity, jakkoli by k takovému názoru úvodní polovina sváděla. Jenže čert to vem, když se zas a znovu budete zasnívat u žalmů pějících termitů či cello metalových cikád...

22035872.review:
Another winner.

Loved Machinerium. Loved Samorost and Samorost 2. Samorost 3 is an outstanding addition to the collection of titles by Aminita Design. Fantastic art and a beautiful soundtrack are used to present a simple yet interesting story in a very imaginative way. The puzzles feel like part of the story and strike just the right balance between being fairly straightforward and a few being a bit more challenging.

If you are a fan of Aminita Design you will not be disappointed. Each new release they refine their process and make the title even better than the last. If you are new to their games I recommend this game whole-heartedly. Be prepared for a unique visual and aural experience…

22035086.review:
In Samorost 3 you play as the titular character, Samorost, who is a gnome clad in white pyjamas who goes on space adventure among the stars. It sounds strange, and it is, but it's the sort of whimsy and wonder that has filled the game from the first (free) flash title 13 year ago. You live on a mossy, chunk of wood that floats around through space, Samorost lives with his dog in a observatory and strange creatures and people inhabit all of the worlds you explore. Early in the game you build a space ship out of a bathtub, waterbottle, stool and giant mushroom; it's wonderful. Everything in the game is amazing to look at and figuring out how things work is a joy. Every screen is a piece of art.

If you've played other Amanita Design games (Machinarium/Botanicula) you'll feel right at home here, and if you're a fan of the previous Samorost titles you'll find the same charm and game design you've come to love and more in a larger, more detailed and elaborate title.

As a grand father that has played Machinarium, Botaniucula, Samorost 1 and 2 wtih eight grand kids that love these games I am not disappointed in Samarost 3. I play through the games and then 'read' them on my laptop as 'bed time' stories with the kids. The lack of dialogue encourages the kids to create their own description of the action. It's a treat to listen to them tell what they see as they see it through the eyes of children and not my tired old eyes. 

I have STEAM accounts for all three of the kids families so Iwill be buying this game three more times and it's well worth the money.

I solved the four- card game to get the jack knife. That clever puzzle will really entertain the kids.

Amanita Designs is one of my favorite studios so I hope they sell  million copies of this game so I can look forward to their next product. And take your time Amanita as the kids love to go through these games numerous times!

Even if you don't have grand kids to share this game with GET IT!

Якуб Дворски сказал: "Мы не планируем пока делать Машинариум 2,  посмотрите Саморост 3, он  вам понравится". 
Это не дословно, но мысль была такая. Он был абсолютно прав. 
Какая игра!  Вся атмосфера, музыка, даже книга прохождений - это все дышит  любовью и специфичным подходом Аманиты Дизайн к своим произведениям. 

Хочется проходить и перепроходить, 
хочется скринить и ставить на рабочий стол, 
хочется слушать музыку и в игре, и просто включая  треки, 

хочется постоянно  танцевать в пижамке вместе с главным героем!

Открыв игру, я просто залипала несколько минут на зайчиков, крутящихся вокруг дома =) 

Одна из немногих игр, когда хочется заплатить вообще любую сумму разработчикам. 
Просто потрясающе. 
Эти ребята делают такие интересные, добрые, атмосферные, душевные, красивые игры!

Thank you for this masterpiece, Amanita! <3
It worth any price, we are so happy that you give us a chance to play such a  beautiful game!
You deserve all good reviewes that you're reading about Samorost 3!
***dancing in my pajamas  with space gnome while playing***

22026749.review:
I remember when I was just a little child I stumbled upon this weird game with a small white clothed gnome and his dog. That game captured my imagination and left a very happy stamp in my mind. It was only many years later, when I found out about Machinarium and suddenly I realized it had to be the same developer, that I realized the game was in fact Samorost - that bizzare game I really liked.

One can only imagine how stoked I was when I found out Samorost 3 is coming out. 30 minutes of playing have already taken me back to those places of mystery I frequented as a child. It feels as if I am reliving my earliest years.

Samorost 3 is 7 times more vibrant and beautiful, and mystical, than its incredible predecessors. It's filled with fantastic imagery, beautiful scenes, vibrant soundtrack, peculiar story, and original and unique mechanics. 

I just want to thank Amanita Design for their originality and loyalism to such a unique genre, in the ever changing environment - that is the video games scene in general. Thank you for such a creative and thought provoking world, and for such a fantastic, amazingly produced game. 

If you liked Machinarium or played Samorost as a child like myself, or hell, just like games that see beyond the horizon, there is no reason you won't like Samorost 3, for it excels in what it does - portray a world the wildest of minds wouldn't be able to think of. I think the price is more than fair considering the amount of love this game got and how carefully and warmly it was handled by its developers. Thank you for a once in a life time experience.

39499709.review:
I can say with confidence that this game is now one of my favorite games of all time.

Samorost 3 is incredibly beatiful in every aspect. The aesthetic of the game as a whole is unique; charmingly odd, incredibly diverse, and does an amazing job of keeping everything feeling like a cohesive part of one world. The environments are bizarrely surreal, and simultaneously full of life. The soundtrack is absolutely gorgeous! There were several moments where I found myself sitting idly in the game just playing around with the interactive music puzzles. 
The sound design also plays a huge part in contributing to creating such immersive worlds and loveable characters. The story itself is also great on its own, but the way in which that story is told is what really brings this game to life.

39555680.review:
J'arrive un peu tard pour dire tout le bien que je pense de ce petit bijou unique, ciselé avec un talent exceptionnel.
Samorost 3 irradie son onirisme halluciné et son ambiance positive de toutes les façons possibles : chacun des fabuleux décors très organiques recèle son lot de bizarreries surprenantes et amusantes, tandis que l'étonnante qualité de travail sur le son et les musiques impressionne carrément pour un "petit" jeu de ce genre!
Plusieurs fois, je me suis arrêtée pour glander à refaire une séquence déjà terminée, simplement pour le plaisir de réentendre des bestioles chanter un truc complètement génial à capella (et voir mon personnage se déhancher sur la musique), ou simplement pour profiter des multiples interactions parfois complètement inutiles qui enrichissent certains écrans.

Le jeu maîtrise la narration visuelle et sonore au point d'énoncer l'intégralité de ses énigmes sans jamais afficher le moindre texte : le scénario comme les indices (agréablement disponibles en permanence pour chaque tableau) s'acquièrent uniquement par des images dans des livres magnifiquement illustrés, et cette communication sans mots s'étend jusqu'aux menus, ou chaque fonction est indiquée de façon intuitive par un dessin cohérent universellement intelligible.
Le jeu est plein de bonnes idées, comme les sons / succès récoltés lors de vos pérégrinations et stockés dans un onglet du menu (où il sera possible de les "mixer" en une musique qui s'enrichit ainsi au fil de l'aventure)...

Ce chef-d’œuvre d'étrangeté est une pépite, un joyau onirique précieux...
Son prix soldé désormais extrêmement abordable (je l'ai touché à moins de 5€) rend son côté relativement éphémère moins problématique (5h seulement en prenant vraiment mon temps).

Une recommandation absolue à tous les amateurs du genre!

39599137.review:
I am actually surprised at how well-rated this game is for something that is supposed to be point-and-click with puzzles. Besides the art being very nice, I think the majority of the game felt lackluster, especially because the puzzles and exploration were almost like you were taking an acid trip on the alien worlds.

Some puzzles seemed very obvious what to do and were boring, whereas many other puzzles gave you no inclination on what to think about. I really disliked the whole flute and sound system aspect, especially with many of the "hints" being such absurd, dream-like objects. Again, some details were obvious, while others just made you think "What the hell?" And if you needed to look at the hints again, it wasted time to travel back somewhere and wait for the weird animations to play out again, because the game relies upon this in order to avoid dialogue and text.

Another key point is that a lot of the time the game suddenly turns into a "hidden object" search where you click around the screen until you find something to interact with, because nearly everything meshes together as singular background and foreground layers.

Really, the style of gameplay pretty much ruined the experience for me, and the excellent visuals do not change the experience that I had to play. I am more for these point-and-click and puzzle games to at least have some aspect of logic behind them, but a large amount of Samorost was bizarre and nonsensical.

39594623.review:
Amanita Design's adventures are always an instant classic for me, and this one makes no exception. They always manage to convey a sense of wonder and a fun, bizarre experience with no need for words or long explanations; just a carefully crafted mix of visual design, sound, puzzles and - this time - music.

Samorost 3 is another cute and weird adventure where the little protagonist will be able to travel to several different worlds and use a magic flute to solve musical riddles, making it the biggest and richest adventure that the studio has made so far. The only let down is that, albeit longer than the previous games, it's still a short adventure that can be finished in 5-6 hours.  Despite this, I recommend playing it to everyone who enjoy point-and-click adventures, especially if you liked the previous Amanita titles: these little games are magical and leave something in your heart that you just can't explain with words.
